page.title: 16EVENTS IN CODICOTE/WELWYN
page.content: The 1985 Codicote Village Day, opened by Mr. Norris McWhirter, was combined with the official opening of the "John Clements Memorial Pavilion" built with Â£15,000 raised locally to commemorate a teacher from Codicote who died trying to save school children in an Italian hotel fire in 1976, for which he was awarded the George Cross. There were many displays, events, sideshows and stalls by village organisations. The annual Welwyn Festival Week oprganised by the local Round Table in June opens with Street Market stalls manned by local groups, proceeds going to these organisations. Day and evening events such as village tours led by a local archeolo- gist, Wild West shows, barbeques etc. culminate in a Carnival Parade through the village to Danesbury Hospital Fete
